Reviews.Title: “Lovely 2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: hmhMidlands
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a fabulous area with lots of characterful bars and restaurants nearby. Very charming with lovely staff. We were there in January so it was nice to come back to a real fire in the reception area and enjoy a drink from the bar. The rooms were small but perfectly formed. I hear that this is common for Paris. We were out sightseeing and were only there for 2 nights so this wasnt a problem.Loved Paris and this hotel and would recommend the area it was in which was safe and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: KPedersen
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Paris together with my husband, and i was so glad we booked this hotel. It was a "home sweet home" feeling already when you entered the cosy lobby. We was upgraded to a de-luxe room which was a really nice start. The room had comfortable beds, a bathroom which was nice and superclean. We walked from hotel to both Notre Dame and Lovre. Lots of restaurants and cafes in the area. We took a taxi from Orly and paid 40 euro from airport to hotel and 30 euro back. The taxi took about 20-30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liseleje
Reviews.Content: We have had a very nice 4 days stay. We had a room facing the backyard and had no noise from outside at all, the frontside is facing a little road with not so much traffic.The hotel has a good location and the metro line B to both Orly or Charles D airport is only 5 min walking away Luxemborg station. Breakfast is easy to get around, just 2 min away on Boulevard Saint Michel nr. 30 you can get af good breakfeast at Pomme de Pain for 6,5 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in Paris (with slightly thin walls)”
Reviews.Author: Eliot22
Reviews.Content: This hotel has so many good qualities, I feel a little bad about posting my one problem with it. Let me start by saying that I would definitely come back to this hotel. The location is convenient (close to the RER and Metro), there are a few bars and restaurants within walking distance and the Jardin Luxembourg is right around the corner. The service is great. Everyone is very friendly and when we stayed here the log fire in the lounge was almost always burning, which worked wonders (it was flipping cold outside). The rooms are looked after very efficiently and so, all in all, this hotel is good value for money. In a city like Paris, this is worth a mention. Such a shame, then, that the walls were so thin that whatever goes on on your floor can be heard at any time of day. This was especially annoying when our amorous neighbours decided to have some quality time the 'Marvin Gaye' way at four in the morning. Nevertheless, I can thoroughly recommend this hotel for its staff, the location and the value for money it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Little Hotel in St. Germain”
Reviews.Author: cwgedge
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this lovely hotel and I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a very clean boutique hotel situated in the middle of the Left Bank. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were small but clean and well kept. We had a nice room facing the courtyard. It is in the perfect location (in St. Germain) for exploring the city; just minutes away from the RER (to the airport) and several Metro stations. I have been the Paris several times and I think this hotel delivers a great experience for the price. You can't ask for much more. A must-stay in this location!

Reviews.Title: “A cosy hotel in the most interesting part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: dreamnumber9
Reviews.Content: We've been coming back to this hotel for years now and it has become home away from home. It is conveniently situated close to the metro station Jardin du Luxembourg, which means that if you arrive in Paris by TGV in the Gare du Nord you don't have to change lines. There are quite a few interesting restaurants in the neighbourhood and it is close to the antiques district in Saint-Germain. The Seine is at 15 minutes walking distance. It is a smallish boutique hotel. The rooms are nice, but like everywhere in Paris on the small side. The breakfast room is quite cramped. It is a quiet hotel, although the last time we visited, we unfortunately had very noisy neighbours. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Look for bargains on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: FLATraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights. We were very happy with our stay and would definitely recommend this hotel. We choose it for the location, and because they offered a good rate for our time of year on their website. We stayed in room 41 on the side of the courtyard and I loved the view of the Paris rooftops. It was very quiet, only three other rooms on our floor and the hotel accommodated our request to have our family member stay in the room next to ours. The staff was so friendly and helpful. We had breakfast three mornings at the hotel which costs 13 euro per person. You can get complimentary coffee in the lobby/bar area and an option to purchase an assortment of 3 pastries for 3 Euro if you want to save money. There are a other breakfast options just outside the hotel, one is just to the right as you walk out that made delicious crepes. The location is very close to several Metro stops. We purchased 10 tickets for each of us and it was the perfect amount for our 6 night stay. You only need one metro ticket and can make as many transfers as needed, but hold on to your ticket as you may need it to exit some of the metro stations after a transfer (only ran into this on two occasions). My husband downloaded several apps on his phone for Paris metro maps, along with the TripAdvisor Paris city guide…very helpful. Our phone was not able to make calls, but we could use it for WIFI which was provided for free at the hotel upon check-in. The rooms are small, but not so small that they are unbearable. They are in the process of remodeling some rooms, ours was the older version which I loved and my mom had a newer modern version. Plenty of toiletries were provided along with a room hair dryer. There was also a mini-fridge that’s part of the minibar that we could put food in and drinks. The only negative was the weekend staff whom would not let us drink our cocktails that we brought down from our room. Because they have a bar in the lobby they apparently do not allow this. Kind of a disappointment since the hotel attendant was someone we had not seen the whole week and the others had been very friendly and accommodating with us. Guess those are the rules though. All in all it was a perfect stay. Was a great neighborhood, I also liked the St. Germain de Pres area and would also consider staying in the Marais area as well if we visit again

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Beat”
Reviews.Author: bobburgess
Reviews.Content: I was in room 55. It faced the courtyard. The hotel is staffed by very professional and kind people. My room was, spotless, large enough for abut 2 feet around the bed, a desk & chair , a closet and an excellent bathroom. This hotel is 5 minutes from the Luxembourg Gardens, the RER station (to DGC airport) and a short walk to St Germain. It's a quiet street. There is a small lobby with a bar . It is not the least expensive I have found but there are deals from time to time and I highly recommend writing or calling to see what is available. I'm sure some of the rooms are smaller than mine so it never hurts to ask. All in all, a terrific hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern & Clean”
Reviews.Author: kms028
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. The rooms were so comfortable and bigger than i expected as i know Paris is notorious for having small rooms. The bathroom even had speakers from the TV just in case you wanted to groove or listen to the show you were watching haha The location was great for the luxemborg area and very close to the metro. However next time i might stay closer to the tower because I feel in love with it. The staff were super friendly. The only negative is being an aussie i really missed my hot breakfast, instead it was continental. I really enjoyed this hotel it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay on Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: wine_searcher
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, in the Latin Quarter close to the Jardin du Luxembourg on one side and lots of bustling bars and restaurants on the other. Notre Dame is an easy walk away and the rest of Paris accessible via the Metro. The hotel room was very small, but that is often the case in a central location in a European capital city. The room and hotel in general were well appointed and the room was clean. Light in the room was a little low for comfortable reading. The bar/lobby had a pleasant sitting area with an open wood fire, which made it very welcoming. Service was polite, friendly and efficient throughout. Overall a very effective base for a Paris visit.

Reviews.Title: “Small but beautiful hotel in St-Germain”
Reviews.Author: schmau
Reviews.Content: The "Clos Medicis" is a small hotel ideally situated in the calm and beautiful St-Germain quarter Paris. It is easily accessible by Underground Metro. There are many small restaurants around the hotel and the neighborhood is safe, even in the late evening. The hotel has a charming lobby with a fireplace, which is lit every evening in autumn and winter. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are quite small (which is normal in Paris) but very clean and quiet. We had a Kingsize bed and a Flatscreen TV in our room. The breakfast is quite rich, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for walking around Paris”
Reviews.Author: LGAretired
Reviews.Content: Friends had stayed at this hotel in 2010 and recommended it to us. The location was an easy walk from the Luxembourg RER B station so we could take the train straight in from CDG (be warned that when you return to CDG you will need to walk with your luggage down 3 flights of steps. The escalators were all up ones). We were able to walk to almost every place we wanted to explore. There were so many cafés and restaurants to choose from within a few blocks of the hotel. Turn left out of the hotel and walk toward Rue de L'Odéon. Try the Les Editeurs café. Or the Polidor restaurant just 2 blocks down from the hotel on the right. The Louvre and Cluny museums were 10-15 minute walks. We even walked to the Musée d'Orsay. And of course the Luxembourg Gardens were just around the corner. Our room (#36) faced the street and it was a bit noisy when we opened the window (trash trucks in the morning and a party outside of the movie theater across the street one evening). The weather was warm for October and we did not think that the air conditioner was really working. But it was cool in the evenings so we were not uncomfortable sleeping. The room size was larger than expected and the bathroom was also roomy. I loved the olive oil soaps provided. The staff were polite and friendly and were kind enough to switch to English when my French ran out. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: brendajoybrown
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It was very conveniently located, and the staff was extremely helpful in suggesting restaurants, calling cabs, etc. The air conditioning in our room really did not work, and since we had the courtyard room, we couldn't leave our door open for fresh air. We did report this, but nothing was done. However, other than than, the room and bathroom were both very nice & we enjoyed our stay tremendously. The on-site breakfast which was extra was well worth the price & we were able to eat outside in the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend at Clos Medicis”
Reviews.Author: Thiago C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a weekend at the Clos Medicis, which we had booked more or less by chance after trying without success to book a room at several other places we normally stay. At 280 euros a night in high season, Clos Medicis was a bit outside our normal range, but in the end we were very happy with the choice and had a great weekend. Our room (#65) was on the top floor, with a very comfortable bed, and was in fact a duplex, with a well designed bathroom on the second floor. Staff were extremely polite and pleasant, and we were treated very well, from arrival to departure. The next time we decide to splurge on a Paris weekend, we will certainly try to book here again. Clos Medicis location was also unbeatable, around the corner from Jardin du Luxembourg, but in quiet street (we had no problems sleeping), 10 minutes walking to Notre Dame, 15 to the Louvre. Rue Monsieur Prince had many restaurants, and was surrounded by great bookshops.

Reviews.Title: “NICE AND COZY HOTEL IN SAINT GERMAIN”
Reviews.Author: RICKBSAS
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is a gem in St. Germain. My room was single, very Small space like other large city in the world, but very comfortable with all the amenities you need. The staff was very very friendly and always had a very good tips from all the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back before the end of the year!”
Reviews.Author: Bevcarriage
Reviews.Content: The hotel is warm and welcoming from the moment you arrive. My room - double for single occupancy - was much bigger than I've ever had at this price in Paris. And I've been to this fabulous city many times. It's in a fantastic position - just a hop over from Place de la Sorbonne, around the corner from the Luxembourg Gardens and a stroll from the Seine. RER Luxembourg is very close and buses are good too. I was lucky and had one of the two hotel balconies. I booked up many months ago and specially requested it. Paris was very very hot last weekend so I loved being able to sit out. Breakfast al fresco was a treat - good coffee and a decent continental selection at a reasonable price. The shower room was bigger than you come to expect in Paris too. I'd strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mldStamford_CT
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, excellent location, small but really nice room. Contemporary room and bath decor. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “The final stage of our honeymoon was amazing.”
Reviews.Author: CandRToronto
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Clos Medicis is a brilliantly located and charming hotel property. The staff were friendly and helpful and helped make our stay in Paris one that we'll never forget. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others looking for a hotel that's within walking distance of many popular sites and of course some fantastic cafes and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent 'compact' hotel”
Reviews.Author: WoolyMonkey
Reviews.Content: Not the biggest rooms in the world but easy walk to Pantheon, Jardin de Luxembourg, Notre Dame and Batobus. Staff courteous and helpful. Use again - yes.

Reviews.Title: “Comme ci comme ça - wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Plinka
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, staying only a couple of nights. Our priorities were to be in a safe neighborhood, near good walking streets, and excellent service - since we had such limited time, don't know the city, and aren't good French speakers. Based on other reviews, we chose Hotel Le Clos Medicis. Well. The location is great, it's true. St. Germain des Pres is a lovely neighborhood. The hotel is a block from Jardin Luxembourg park, formerly palace grounds - gorgeous, and a special bonus for kids because they can sail toy boats in one of the pools, see a puppet show, etc. There's a nice cafe on the corner (Luxembourg Cafe) to use as a homebase. The hotel was tiny but clean, with a chic little lounge and lobby. The idea that the little bar is open all the time is a bit sketch - you're dependent on whomever staffs the reception desk to come over and serve you (do all front desk staff train in mixing drinks?). We did not breakfast there, so I can't comment on that. The room itself ("Deluxe" category) was smaller than I'd expected from web photos; maybe we got a particularly small one or the photos are a bit misleading, but it was acceptable by wacky Paris standards. Very nice bathroom with good shower-bath. Air conditioner worked quietly and effectively. Beds were comfortable with nice linens. Here's where the experience really fell flat for us: Hotel Le Clos Medicis did not at all deliver in the service department, mostly due to one woman who unfortunately manned the desk for most of our stay. She was so inexplicably rude and haughty, it was almost laughable - the living, breathing negative Parisian stereotype. We absolutely did not come in as demanding Americans, overly familiar and barking at everyone in English - quite the opposite. I did my best with halting French, we were sensitive to the French predilection for more formal manners, expressed gratitude, etc. But she was so unpleasant from the get-go that we loathed having to approach the desk for information or recommendations - precisely what we'd hoped this hotel would provide. Her discourteous response to even the tiniest requests - such as a room key or a glass of water from the bar for an elderly guest - were so unpleasant that we just tried to stay out of her way. A neighboring guest kept us awake late one night with loud drunken telephone conversation, but I just didn't have the heart to call the front desk to do something about it. The loud drunk was almost preferable. The one time she was inexplicably friendly turned out to be the day her boyfriend came to visit - as we left the hotel, they began making out passionately in the hotel doorway. Pas professionnel. One other young woman and a gentleman we encountered briefly at reception were both very gracious. Unfortunate that the hotel has someone on their staff during prime time (Friday and Saturday afternoon and evening) who made our experience so negative. A couple other notes: - Avoid the Japanese restaurants on the street - harmless but subpar. - For guests with children: what they call a child's "cot" is, in fact, a pack-and-play type thing, unsuitable for children over 2 yrs (their limit is 3 years). It'll also cost you $25 euro extra per night. - Our room safe did not work. Upon inquiring whether someone could fix it, or we could put our items in their desk safe, I was told to bring it to the front desk. They put my ipad and camera in an envelope. Upon later return, I was shocked to have it handed to me off a sideboard sitting behind the little front desk. The envelope had sat out the whole time within grabbing reach; much of the time the reception person isn't sitting at the little desk at all. It was never put in a safe - I don't think they have one.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: CoffeeHound58
Reviews.Content: Earlier in April I traveled to Paris with a friend, via the TGV from Zurich. We found the Hotel Le Clos Medicis to be the ideal choice. Great location, wonderful staff and comfortable rooms. As has been stated, in Paris the hotel rooms are on the cozy side and this was no exception; yet the comfortable touches were ample. The beds in particular were very good, and I appreciated the roomy tub and shower. The complaints I have are minor. 1st, the shower partition; try as I might, I could not avoid getting water on the floor unless I just gave up and had a bath instead. Also, a few drawers for storing personal items in the bedroom would have been nice. Free wi-fi was appreciated. Our rate included breakfast, and we enjoyed it very much - especially as the weather was perfect and we could eat outside in the terrace. All the staff, from the people at the front desk to the lovely server in the breakfast room were very helpful and kind. I will recommend Hotel Le Clos Medicis to my friends and I hope to return someday soon with my husband for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: 23betty
Reviews.Content: We had four nights at this hotel and were really pleased with our choice. It is in a great location, walking distance from the Louvre and Notre Dame and close to many bars and restaurants. The hotel reception features a wood burning fire and always felt very warm and welcoming when we returned from days out in the cold. It always smelt lovely too, I don't know what they used but it was gorgeous! Our room was on the top floor and although small (as are most rooms in Parisian hotels I believe) it was comfortable and clean. Again it was always cosy in the cold weather but also had windows which you could open if necessary. We didn't bother with breakfast in the hotel as it wasn't included and there are plenty of options near to the hotel. The staff were professional and helpful. For us, the location made this hotel perfect and we would stay there again. A few tips for nearby:- Le Petit Journal St Michel - jazz club. Had a great evening here with meal and jazz music and friendly staff. Lots of small cinemas nearby and we spent a rainy afternoon watching a film in English (with French subtitles) Seraphin Brasserie and restaurant - had a good meal here in a great environment.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, welcoming, convenient but a bit cramped”
Reviews.Author: paulhk_lym
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the rooms are clean and comfortable though rather small. We expected this as we had read previous reviews. Hotels in the centre of Paris are inevitably expensive, but this one didn't completely break the bank. It is situated very conveniently for local services, with dozens of not-so-expensive restaurants within five to ten minutes walk and is also very convenient for the public transport hub at the bottom of the Boulevard St-Michel. Breakfast can be a bit of a squeeze if many guests arrive all at once. The room we stayed in was very quiet with only a very, very distant rumble from passing underground trains - certainly not enough to keep you awake.

Reviews.Title: “Experience a real Parisian Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: EuropeCosmicTravel
Reviews.Content: Quaint rooms, though typical small bath. Just enough room for a chair and a double bed in the room. Beamed ceilings and windows over the courtyard were nice. Beautiful lobby with fireplace. Skipped the breakfast and went to the bakery and muffin shop nearby instead. Free wifi was nice. In the spring I'm sure the neighborhood is absolutley gorgeous. Metro accessible if you remeber to take the left exit out of the station :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, charming and relax”
Reviews.Author: izarauz
Reviews.Content: Stayed there several times for work, and this time took my wife with me. She just loved it, it is very cozy and charming. Rooms are not big but enough to relax after discovering Paris. It is located right in the middle of Saint Germain de Pres, but far enough of the ambiance noise, so that is a good thing. Metro is right on the corner to go to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Le Clos Medicis, the little hotel with a big impression”
Reviews.Author: marygrisky
Reviews.Content: This is the second time in 6 months at this hotel and both times it has been an excellent experience. Hotel staff are super and I can garantee that you won't find a cleaner hotel. Great location and it really is central to everything. I just can't say enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Roussillonfoodie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Year and were impressed. The hotel was by far the best of any we have stayed in in Paris. We were upgraded to a de luxe room which was still not exactly spacious but very comfortable and the bed (I am VERY fussy) was excellent. The small bathroom was spotless but is for one at a time!!!! Apprciated the free Wifi. The breakfast room is compact but although we felt the price was a bit steep we enjoyed the fresh fruit, excellent juice and as much espresso coffee as we wanted. The staff are delightful, especially if you speak French. They must get sick of visitors who refuse even to say good-morning or thankyou - just common politness i feel. Our only two slight niggles were the lack of drawers and a full length mirror and the fact that to access the safe one had to lie flat on one's tummy (not easy at our age!) We will most certainly be back

Reviews.Title: “Straightforward good value in expensive Paris”
Reviews.Author: Travellinghawk777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is straightforward and represents good value in this central part of Paris. I spent a very pleasant week there. Right near the Latin Quarter and Odeon, it's an ideal left-bank base for boutique shopping, visiting the left bank, and general touring. Very convenient from the Luxembourg RER B stop (to/from CDG airport). The rooms are small, which is typical but very clean with excellent beds and small nice bathrooms. The breakfast is not included and so-so (unless you're very hungry, since it is a buffet). I prefer a more French breakfast around the corner with better coffee in some of the local cafés (recommend the Rostand or the Danton nearby). The lounge is very cozy with a winter fire and a limited but pleasant bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for the Luxembourg/St Germain area”
Reviews.Author: WendsPaisley
Reviews.Content: Just back from our 5th trip to Paris and glad we picked this hotel. We love the area around the Pantheon/Jardins de Luxembourg/St Germain and it was ideally placed for all of these and much more. The hotel itself is clean, cosy and comfortable and the room size was fine for purpose ie. sleeping and a rest between exploring the city all day and going out for dinner at night. Bathroom was a decent size with a good shower but why do they insist on these 'sticks with air' purporting to be hairdryers? A recipe for frizz! We didn't have breakfast in the hotel (around 12eu) as we prefer to go to our favourite brasserie, Le Comptoir du Pantheon, where you get the usual Continental for 6.50eu in the coolest of settings... Oh, to have been a student at La Sorbonne! Alternatively, there's a fab friendly little bakery, Le Fournile, doors along from the hotel which serves coffee, OJ & 2 croissants for just 4.20eu. If it had been summer, we'd have bought quiche and pastries there, popped into the Nicolas wine shop opposite for some vin rose and had a picnic down by the Seine or in the Jardins des Plantes. For dinner, there are loads of places nearby. I wanted to try Au Pere Louis but it was jam packed so we went to La Ferrandaise instead. To be honest, I was disappointed as I felt it had aspirations above its capabilities and for the price, the food was hit and miss. We had a much nicer meal in Chez Nadine in the Mouffetard. Personally, I think in Paris, your best best is to have the Plat de Jour/Menu Fixe or go really high end. Re the hotel, I would definitely recommend it for location and comfort - absolutely no complaints. Note to hubby - thanks for making our 10 year Anniversary magical. Le Comptoir will remain 'our place' for ever, now with added 'sparkle'....

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, location”
Reviews.Author: Grice-Fearing
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our 5-night stay at le Clos Medici in Paris. The location was great and the service was really outstanding. Vu was the best concierge -- he helped us numerous times with reservations, printing boarding passes, etc. The rooms were typically Parisian-small, but we spotless and the bathrooms were spacious. Loved the complimentary WiFi, too. We would recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “COSY, CLEAN, FRIENDLY AND GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: william_hickman
Reviews.Content: We were on a week-end break so good location and a reasonable hotel was important, the Hotel Le Clos Medicis was that and more. A friendly and helpful staff, a beautiful small outside courtyard to have breakfast if the weather was suitable - which it was, although the room was small (normal in Paris ) it was very clean and had character, it was on the top floor but a lift was available. The location was perfect. A 10 minute stroll to the Seine, and a wonderful park nearby which was used by the locals, free chairs, wonderful gardens , a lake and much more, wherever you stay the Jardin du Luxenbourg gardens are a must. A short but wonderful holiday for a young 60's couple - that's us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: swegam
Reviews.Content: For our third trip to Paris my wife and I (aged 50-55) wanted to return to the Luxembourg Gardens area, to a 3-star hotel, and the Hotel le Clos Medicis was the perfect location, offering a great discount rate for our planned 5 day stay in early Novembe 2010. Direct connection on the RER "B" train from Charles de Gaulle Airport, dropped us off at Luxembourg Gardens, half a block from the hotel for only 9 Euros. We chose the "Standard" size room with Queen-size bed. Room was small by American standards, but normal for Paris, while bathroom and shower were quite large and excellent. As the name implies, the hotel is on a quiet side-street and "closed off" from city noise. Staff was excellent and service was outstanding. It's all about Location, Location, Location, and Clos Medicis has it. The block has excellent restaurants, a sandwich shop next door that opens for breakfast 7 days a week, two mini-grocery stores on the corner, along with a wine store, and even a laundrymat on the next block. When we asked to stay longer, the Hotel accommodated our request and let us keep our room (at the discount rate.) There are no American-style ammenties, beyond the standard mini-fridge and safe (for valuables) in the room. TV reception was great and the free Wi-Fi was excellent. If you don't bring a laptop, hotel has a free computer (to print your airport boarding pass) and there is an Internet Cafe up the street (charging only 2 Euros per hour.) It is a 5 minute walk to the Metro at the Cluny, and a 10 minute stroll down the Boulevard Saint Michel to Notre Dame Cathedral, along the way passing the fabulous Gilbert Joseph bookstore and the awesome Monoprix grocery/department store (3 floors). If you know what you want to do and see in Paris, Hotel le Clos Medicis is the perfect staging point. But, if you have a car, this Metro-accessible hotel may not be best, as street parking is very limited (and narrow.)

Reviews.Title: “NO VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Travellswithmyaunt
Reviews.Content: Altough the hotel is well situated, I wouldn't recomend it. Rooms are extremely small and inside bathrooms you can't almost move. I made a mistake taking a superior room it was the smallest room hotel iI have ever seen. The view (and smell) came from a patio, and it was not worth the money at all. Staff is correct, but that's all.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Elisabm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this cozy hotel for three nights in mid October. It is very close to the subway and the RER B station. Lots of restaurants and cafes in the neighbourhood and within walking distance of Notre Dame and Ile Saint Louis. We did not try the breakfast served, since there were so many options around. The room we had was the double basic one and we were very satisfied with it. It was perfectly clean and the bathrom was modern. Yes, it was small, but we got an early booking rate of E140 which is a real deal for a hotel of such category in the Luxembourg area. In addition, we only splept in the hotel, so we did not need a big room. The staff is very attentive and ready to help you at any time (literally). We were in Paris during the strikes and the staff helped us in finding a car to rent, since our train to Tours had been canceled. That happened at 01:00 a.m... If we go back to Paris, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service is the key!”
Reviews.Author: Butcher1961
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out the staff at Clos Medicis were fantastic. A small historical hotel well located to RER station and other tourist sites in central Paris. The room I had was average in size compared to other larger chain hotels in Europe but suitable for my 5 day stay given the only time I was there was to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: stato08
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel could not be any better. You have everything on your doorstep including fantastic bars, cafes and the best restaurants we have ever eaten in. The hotel is spotless with superb service. The rooms are a little small (the norm for paris)but with the deluxe we had a huge private terrace and it was furnished to a very high standard for just a three star. We didn't have the breakfast because of the cafes outside but the small bar/lounge area is lovely. Very classy place. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home, would highly recomend”
Reviews.Author: maddog7529
Reviews.Content: A cosy little home from home nestled in the heart of the latin quarter. currently a 3 star although easily qualifies for more. Rooms are reasonable size, clean and modern, unfortunatly we didn't experience having a bath in the room but the shower more than made up for it, big enough for 2 and powerfull enough to exfoliate your skin. Breakfast is basic but nice ( cereals, fruit, yoghurt etc ... the usual really) but when eaten in the quaint little courtyard it just feels right. would highly recommend and would visit again any time...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: arbie76
Reviews.Content: This was receommended by family and it didn't disappoint. A traditional/modern mix in terms of decor and atmosphere, befitting the history of the hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful, though sometimes our limited french meant we didn't get the most out of them. Breakfast was in the courtyard, which was beautiful, and was basic but v tasty. Location is pertect for buses, the metro, jardin de luxenbourg (2 mins walk) and the pantheon (5 mins walk). If you're walkers like us, you wont have any probs walking to places like the louvre either. Overall - very happy.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Most Desirable Neighborhood of Paris”
Reviews.Author: balletomanehk
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel located in the most peaceful and charming neighborhood of Paris--Jardin de Luxembourg area in St Germain. The location is very convenient as it is close to all the sights and shopping streets of St Germain as well as many nice cafes and restaurants. Many different bus routes are just a few minutes' walk away from the hotel, and we took advantage of the bus in lieu of the metro so we could even get some sightseeing done along the way to our destinations. The hotel staff was really helpful and highly professional in every way, giving us useful advice and even helping us with our luggage when our taxi arrived (something unexpected from a hotel of this scale). Our room was quite small and hardly had enough space for us to lay our medium-sized suitcase open... other than that everything was perfect. Very clean, fresh toilet, comfortable bed, nice contemporary design that's easy on the eyes, and good air conditioning that was a godsend during the heat wave we experienced. The sound insulation was good and we did not hear any noise from neighbors or from the street. The courtyard looks lovely although we didn't make use of it. Wi-fi was free and good. We enjoyed our stay very much and would consider this hotel when we visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great location, quiet street”
Reviews.Author: dbattag580
Reviews.Content: Great location. Close to le Jardin du Luxembourg, the Pantheon, several cafes to eat. There is a movie theater across the street and the metro stop is not too far of a walk. We had two rooms, a Classic single room and a deluxe double room. Rooms were clean and roomy enough, though no drawer space aside from a shelf in a closet. Bathrooms were very nice, but a bit small. We did not eat at the hotels breakfast that looked very good but pricey at 13 euros per person. We ate at local boulangeries and patisseries for far less. They have a computer in the lobby hallway for anyone to use which was very convenient. Staff was superb and very helpful. It was hot and humid during our stay and the air conditioning was bordering on unacceptable, but the rooms did cool down after several hours. The system seemed to be at it's max. Rooms have a small minibar which we did not use. There are in room safes in the closets. There is an outside garden like space to sit at in the evening and you could get a drink from the bar if you like. Overall we liked this hotel and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel in the summer”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveler60
Reviews.Content: I am not really understanding the experiences of these other travelers, but we stayed at the Hotel Le Clos Medicis in their best rooms, and in two different rooms, at the end of June. The air conditioning did not work at all - during hot days, the 'air' was a fan that circulated hot air, and we were told that was the maximum capacity of the air conditioning. It came near to ruining our trip to Paris, and was especially aggravating in that we checked with the hotel directly prior to staying with them, about their air conditioning situation. Additionally, the lobby furniture was uncomfortable and the lobby space uninviting. That said, the staff was invariably professional and attentive, and we always prefer small hotels with quiet rooms, and this is such a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in an interesting area”
Reviews.Author: wendydee
Reviews.Content: Lovely old hotel, well renovated. Service, breakfast and setting were very good. Air conditioning was a Godsend, on one of the hottest weekends of the year. Breakfast was very good. Very near the Pantheon, The Luxembourg Gardens, the Cluny Museum, The Sorbonne -- all within an easy stroll. Seine down at the end of the Bld St Michel, only about 15 min away from Notre Dame and "Batobus" stop, for River access to tourist attractions. Very convenient with a lovely atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Le Clos Medici - cool boutique hotel, modern, clean, well located”
Reviews.Author: Tamsin32
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded for free from a Superior to a Deluxe room! Small hotel but lovely atmosphere, very nice receiption and bar area. Location is superb (lots of restaurants and bars nearby) and 6 minute walk to Odeon metro station. Very quiet street (no traffic noise). There is a lift (for those not wanting to walk up multiple flights of stairs to the rooms). The staff could not have been more helpful. They recommended (patiently dealing with all our questions) two restaurants and made bookings for us - La Bastide Odeon - Provencal style food, quiet, grown-up style restaurant, and Alcazar - bar/club/restaurant, very NY style - both delicious! Only slight problem was that the shower screen in our room was very narrow so we ended up with a lot of water on the bathroom floor...... but it would not stop me going back again.

Reviews.Title: “ideal quiet and central location”
Reviews.Author: Anaesthetist1977
Reviews.Content: Le Clos Medicis is an unpretentious, comfortable little hotel between the 5th and 6th arrondisement. The location is idealis you come from the CdG Airport, as you can take the RER B to Luxembourg - the stop is 100m from the hotel. The Pantheon and Sorbonne Uni are only a few blocks away, but what likedmost were the morning strolls through the Jardin du Luxembourg, which is literally just round the corner (the corner wheer Jean Luc Godard filmes his short film "Charlotte et Veronique). The lobby is very welcoming with a fireplace, bar, sofas and free newspapers and the friendly staff speaks english. Rooms are not excessively big, but absolutely sufficient for solo travellers or for city breaks (those with massive suitcases might struggle) and although my room was next to the elevator there was no noise disruption. I skipped breakfast (not included) as there's no French breakfast worth 10+EUR - I recommend to discover one of the great french bakeries in the area: my favourite: Eric Kayser - conveniently on the way to the Orsay (yes, Louvre, Orsay, Notre Dame are all in walking distance) Im summary: recommendable no frills hotel in the best arrondisement of Paris

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION IN A LOVELY AREA”
Reviews.Author: giannapj
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, location is absolutely a must, in a quite street (for a good sleep) but near restaurants, bars, shops, transports... the Luxembourg park is literally around the corner, the Pantheon and the Sorbonne just a step away, between the Latin quarter and the saint Germain area. we got a good rate directly from their website for a superior room. it was on the top floor and so it was quite. the bathroom was nice, small but enough for two and perfectly clean! the room was not big, i guess a Paris standard, the carpet was not particularly clean and maybe some part of the walls could be redecorated. the television was not working very well on our last evening, but it was not an issue. the bed was a bit small 140 cm wide, so i would advise to chose the deluxe room as it comes with a larger one. we did not have breakfast as there were so many fantastic patisserie around!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cosy hotel - good location - lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: incrociate
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Le Clos Medicis in December. It's a small, nice hotel. The rooms are tastefully decorated and really nice. The room we had wasn't very big, but okay for a hotel in the centre of Paris. The bathroom had a large shower and was really clean. There were bathrobes provided, as well as a range of lovely products. Location is key for this hotel. Everything you need is nearby: underground station, car park, night shops, restaurants (don't eat at The Luxembourg though, overpriced and the food didn't taste good), a Starbucks, loads of shops, etc. The hotel lobby has a fireplace and there's also a bar. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as we found it a bit expensive (13 euro pp). We did enjoy the free wifi (get your password at the reception desk). We will definitely come here again. Loved the room, the hotel helped make this a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot lovely staff can't wait to go again”
Reviews.Author: ImeldaDubai
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel about ten minutes walk to the Seine and the Notre Dame with plentiful bars, cafes and restaurants nearby. The staff are friendly and helpful and most speak good English. The rooms aren't huge but very attractive, cosy and well serviced. In my experience there was virtually no noise from the street but we were on the top (fifth) floor. The only negative is that the walls between rooms appear to be quite thin and you can hear neighbours' talking. Breakfast is simple but plentiful and good quality. The bar in the lobby is relaxing and welcoming, especially with the fire burning. I will certainly stay at this hotel again. Good value for money too in my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, clean hotel, friendly stuff - great location - nice restaurants around!”
Reviews.Author: Mariabgr
Reviews.Content: Our room was really small, but clean and quiet, on the 5th floor. They had paid a lot of attention to every detail, making it charmful with a rustique atmosphere. Our only complaint is that almost all the tv channels were in french (but who needs to watch tv while visiting Paris?). The staff was friendly and helpful and almost all of them spoke english quite well. The hotel was well situated in a quiet area, really close to Pantheon, Sorbonne university, Jardins de Luxembourg and in a walking distance of river Seine, Notre Dame and even Musee de Louvre! We were surprised by the fact that we could walk to almost every monument we wanted to visit! The street, Monsier Le Prince, had a lot of nice restaurants and we tried all the croissants and quiche from the boulangerie next to the hotel - the price for breakfast in the hotel was really high (13 euros / person).

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: SydneyNell
Reviews.Content: Believe the comments on trip advisor, this hotel was great. It was the first stop on our honeymoon and we loved it. The location was fantastic, easy to get to from the airport and just near the beautiful gardens and le'open air bus tour. Room was clean and cosy and the staff were very friendly. Breakfast was great and there was a convenience store not far down the street. Lots of restaurants/cafes to eat at all very close. I would highly recommend this warm and friendly hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “As good as anticpated”
Reviews.Author: surfroberto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a birthday get together with some old friends. I had read a number of reviews and settled on this hotel. Two other couples also booked - it was everything we had hoped for and more. The rooms and bathrooms were spotless and the staff could not be more helpful. The air conditioning proved its worth over the week-end given the heatwave.Location and accesibility was perfect for us. Will certainly return .

Reviews.Title: “Paris Gem- We'de stay again for sure!!!”
Reviews.Author: nursebelle
Reviews.Content: Great location & good sized (by Paris standards) rooms that are modern & with good attention to detail. Our bathroom was gorgeous! There is free WiFi & the staff are friendly! Not a cheap hotel but well worth it & a great location for shopping & dining...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: elliedavies
Reviews.Content: Having visited Paris many times and stayed in many hotels, this one was excellent. Would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not good enough for the price”
Reviews.Author: PeteCanada
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 5 nights at this hotel, having pre-paid for it. I expected a deluxe room, as seen on the hotel's website -- one with an ottoman chair. Instead I was given what appeared to be a standard room, with only one hardback chair and somewhat cramped space on the top floor with a skylight. The room was quiet, clean and the bathroom was spotless and spacious -- probably the only strong points of the room. The entranceway in the hall was very narrow and cramped, not the best place for hauling a few pieces of luggage up one flight of stairs then past a self-closing doorway that had to be held open with one arm while luggage is wheeled thru with the other, all the while standing on the top step of stairs! Acrobatic or what? There was free internet at a Dell computer on the main floor, for guest use. That's a big plus, since many Parisian hotels do not provide computer use (i.e. you don't need to bring your laptop if you just want to check email). The location was great -- across from the Luxembourg Gardens, and a few steps away from the 21, 27, and 63 bus lines for scenic travelling in central Paris. Lots of restaurants and cafes nearby, so that was an additional bonus. This was my 9th trip to Paris in 12 years. I prefer the Latin Quarter for its ambience and laid-back atmosphere. Although the location was terrific, I would rather have stayed at the Hotel des Grands Hommes a bit up the road at place du Pantheon -- the rooms there were more spacious on my previous visits. French hotel rooms in this price range are small, but I expected more space for the money I paid, not Hilton-style roomy, but certainly more than what I received.

Reviews.Title: “Just location”
Reviews.Author: lukaszwenda
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel. When we arrived our room was not ready so reception gave us very small interior room on the second floor. For the same money you can easily find better place. Apart from location this hotel has nothing to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful first stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Gennie5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at this hotel on a 10 year anniversary trip through several countries. We spent many hours looking at reviews and deciding on the best location to stay as we knew we would have a short time to see many sites in the city. We could not have been happier with our choice. The front desk personnel were exceptionally friendly and helpful-recommending two great places to eat during our stay. They also advised us on transportation options. The location is right around the corner from the Luxembourg Gardens, minutes from Notre Dame, and an easy walk from the Louvre. The hotel serves a small but lovely cold buffet breakfast each morning (additional charge) in the courtyard. The rooms are not large, but there was plenty of room to set our bags and move around. The room and bathroom were very clean and the bed was large and comfortable. There was a flatscreen TV with at least 2 English channels. A nice lounge area in the lobby was a great place to sit and have a drink or plan the days activities. We had a very enjoyable stay and would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: hbarton88
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and the rooms are beautifully renovated. The bathroom, though somewhat small, had an amazing shower/tub with great water pressure and very pleasing decor. The bed was very comfortable. Even though there was some construction going on less than a block away, you couldn't hear it through the well-insulated windows. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The lobby was very inviting and always had a fire lit in the fireplace. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: schnucky_schnook
Reviews.Content: We loved the modern and well-designed rooms. The bathroom was also clean and bright with nice tiling in the large, double-doored shower. The bedroom was small but seemed bigger than the 11 sq. m. we were expecting from our booking confirmation. The open fire in the foyer is a nice touch. We didn't go for the 10 euro breakfast but instead opted for the cafe two doors down which was exceptionally good value for Paris. As for location, a stone's throw from the Jardin du Luxebourg, Church of St. Sulpice, Pantheon, Latin Quarter and the wide array of restaurants along Rue Mouffetard. We recommend Pot du Terre on the Rue Pot du Fer... We really liked the deal we got which was if you book and pay in full well in advance you save considerably. MAKE SURE TO CHECK THE SPECIAL OFFERS...

Reviews.Title: “City retreat.”
Reviews.Author: gaildivine01
Reviews.Content: Hi my partner and I recently returned from a lovely 4 day break to Paris. To give a you an idea of how we reviewed this hotel; We are both in our early 30s and I in particular enjoy attention to detail and excellent service with complementing surroundings, he on the other hand is content with a bed and roof over his head. I found and booked the hotel through http://www.cybevasion.com/ and got a very competitive rate, almost 100€ a night cheaper than all other on line booking sites! The room was very well sized by any standard and especially by Parisian standards. The reception area was excellent with an open fire and very welcoming with helpful staff who went out of their way to accommodate all my queries. Good points: A little on the small side but had a well enough sized bath- a welcoming comfort after a long day exploring Paris in the winter months. However nothing to write home about(who would about a bathroom!) but still not inadequate. The size of the room and storage space was plentiful. The colour scheme in the room was very modern and had really charming exposed beams making for a very romantic setting. The room we stayed in was the one advertised on the website- room 14. The only minor complaints we had were: 1. our bed was two singles put together to make a double and this was not overly comfortable. 2. The room is on the street side and at 4am on Tuesday the rubbish bin collectors were picking up waste and had flashing orange lights and loud pick up trucks waking us up at a very early hour- not the hotel's fault, but might be a better option to book a room not over looking the street. Or risk it as the room is wonderful! Overall rating of this hotel is as described. It is a very comfortable and a well kept hotel in a brilliant location. 2 minutes walk from Jardin de Luxembourg and 10 to the Notre Dame. Highly recommended. We travelled to Paris Beauvais and transport from the Airport was very easy. A bus departs from the airport after every flight arrival and tickets cost €13 each way bookable on: http://www.aeroportbeauvais.com/bus.php?lang=eng or you can purchase the tickets on arrival. The bus then takes you to Port Maillot on the Metro line this takes approx 1 hour. There you can either purchase a single from the booth in the metro or a Carnet of 10 for €11. If you intend to use the metro a little it's worth the book purchase (une Carnet) and you can share the tickets. I advise you map your journey before you arrive on the web site: http://www.ratp.info/orienter/cv/carteparis.php. This is a very easy metro map to use and SO useful. Click on the green flag for your departure point and the red for you arrival point and the map will show you the line. There are too many wonderful things to do in Paris that I will leave it up to you to plan you itinerary but if you have any queries please e mail and I will be happy to advise. Have fun and pack some good walking shoes with you. Please note; Paris is a very expensive city and most bars will charge a standard €10 for a spirit and meals cost from €20 per head, unless eating in Brasseries which are very reasonable. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good area”
Reviews.Author: bluebell25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a great location, within walking distinace of many places. The RER Luxembourg is close which is handy for the Gare du Nord and is direct. The beautiful Jardin de Luxembourg is also very close. The staff were very extremely kind and helpful. The room was a little disappointing,smaller than I hoped and the furnishings were a little tired, though the bathroom was very nice, clean and modern. I had booked a deluxe double. I think this is an ok option, but I have stayed in other hotels in the same area and for the price would choose one of those for my next trip. The breakfast is expensive and there are cafes nearby which are just as good. There is a nice courtyard for drinks though (the hotel has a little bar) and where breakfast can be taken in clement weather.

Reviews.Title: “charming - loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: dancingcloud33
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a gem! We stayed 3 nights in a small but adequate-sized (for Europe) room. The location of the hotel - within easy walking distance to the Seine, Notre Dame, Louve, Luxenborg Gardens, shopping was perfect. It was always such a relief to come back to the hotel and its many comforts!! The best part about staying here was the staff - no matter what time of day or night, the staff was always very friendly and helpful. They met all our requests with a smile and made us feel very welcome and like valued guests. In fact, just about everyone that we dealt with in France was courteous - and Paris is simply a magical city! The staff recommended a restaurant down the street - very country French - you sit at big wooden tables with people you don't know - but the food was excellent and the prices reasonable. I can't remember the name, but it is down the same street as the hotel on the right hand side as you walk toward the river. I would love to come back and stay here again. It was not inexpensive, but to me having the staff to rely on, a comfortable room, and a great location are what makes traveling enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Charming place in great location”
Reviews.Author: dsbali
Reviews.Content: I stay in Paris regularly and this is one of the places I often book. It's in a great location (St. Germain / Jardin Luxembourg just steps away). Good transport access in terms of the RER from the airport or metro Odeon from Gare du Nord (both are direct trains). And the hotel is simple, charming, warm and quite modern. Overall a nice atmosphere and reasonable value for money given the location. Rooms are not huge etc and we're not talking high-end luxury, but overall I really like it and the webiste pictures are a good representation of the place.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming introduction to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Astrotravel
Reviews.Content: It was my wife's choice. It was my treat to celebrate a Special Birthday. We travelled to Paris on the Orient Express - FANTASTIC - best food ever, cooked by Anatole ( TV Jeeves fans will know him) and took a taxi to the hotel from Gard du Nord. Very pleasant reception in this Left Bank hotel in a street which oozes Paris (it has its own Website !!). Our room (31) looked out over the inner courtyard and was so quiet at night you thought you were in the middle of the countryside.. not one crying baby or discordant music. It had a modern showerroom/toilet, comfortable bed, flat screen TV with BBC World (little news about Britain !) and that was about it. So a room to sleep in rather than relax in. But the neat breakfast area served up the traditional Continental breakfast under the delightful eye of a charming young lady. There was a cool courtyard for sunny (?) mornings. Other guests were most respectable (!), whilst all the desk staff were the same, all speaking good English and very helpful. Paris was closeby. But we got lost !! The nearest underground is Odeon, though equally close isCluny la Sorbonne. Coming out of the wrong exit of Odeon we took 30 minutes to find our bearings - in pouring rain of course - as the street maps did not show our hotel road - we were in the 5th arrondisment not the 6th !! So take a good map with you. Cluny la Sorbonne gives you direct access to Boulevard St. Michel. Walk South along here until you get to the junction with Rue de Medicis and the Luxembourg gardens. . The tiny street adjoining is Rue Monsieur le Prince and the hotel 50 yards on the left. From Odeon its a little more complicated though the other end of the hotel street is close by and you'll have to climb the slight incline to the far end to get to the hotel. But make sure you exit at the 'back' entrance from the train... As for Paris ... well no tourist book is adequate. Just wander and enjoy. The only downside - especially after the food on the Orient Express - was the cuisine, mostly disappointing, sometimes awful and too expensive - four coffees: FOURTEEN POUNDS. So sorry cannot recommend any restaurant, including the much lauded one in the hotel street. Sadly the nearby branch of the famous Chartier chain was closed for the holidays - now THAT would have been OK.... But if you want a quiet hotel, no frills and and a helpful staff can certainly recommend Le Clos Medicis - they might even have finished the external decoration by the time you go.... Final tip - make sure you tell the taxi driver EXACTLY where you want to go. On leaving we asked for the Garde du Nord - and ended up at the Gare du Lyon. That was an extra 15 Euros on the fare..... and nail biting to connect with the home going Eurostar - the best way to travel (apart, of course, from the Orient Express....and Anatole's food.....) back to the UK. Tony and Hilary Ireland Cheltenham England Astrotravel

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: LuciBrasil
Reviews.Content: Clean room. But dark and small. Great staff , good location. Very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Le Clos Medicis”
Reviews.Author: Seedman
Reviews.Content: We had a marvelous time at this extremely well-located hotel on the Left Bank. We were able to take the blue line train from the CDG airport to the Luxembourg station (9 euros). From the station is was a very easy walk to the hotel. The staff were super accommodating and extremely tolerant of English-speaking Americans. We were always greeted by an enthusiastic "Bonjour!". The courtyard used as the setting for "la petite dejeuner" is charming. There was some exterior construction going on, in early August, but it was not that annoying. Rooms were very comfortable with bathtubs. The location is superb. You can stumble to the Luxembourg Gardens. Once you stay at this hotel, you will want to live in Paris forever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast, Helpful Warm Staff, Not so good Bathtub”
Reviews.Author: OctoberSun
Reviews.Content: Very easy walk from the train station from the airport, just across the road. The hotel is on a quiet sidestreet with lots of sushi bars and a grocer's just down the road and restaurants along the main street which makes it very convenient. When we arrived it was first thing in the morning and they had our room ready. It was on the ground floor which made it a bit dark, but we had a good sized bathroom. Only problem was that the water pressure was very poor and the bath tub had no shower curtain so you had to bathe in a squatting position which isn't comfortable at all. Apart from that, the internet worked fine, the amenities were well provided and the breakfast at 10Euro was delicious. The counter staff were helpful when we asked for suggestions and directions and you should have a look at the wonderful picture book near the entrance. The sofas in the front are cosy and I think this is a great hotel to stay in in the summertime. Hope they upgrade the showers though.

Reviews.Title: “4 Nights at the Clos Medicis”
Reviews.Author: jjblock
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 5 day/4 night trip to Paris. We stayed at the Clos Medicis based on reviews on tripadvisor.com and photos from the website. We were not disappointed! The rooms were small but, actually bigger than I imagined. Beds were very comfortable and the a/c worked great! Our bathroom was a good size, the shower was excellent too. Not sure if the water in Paris is considered 'hard' but, our hair felt pretty gross the whole time. There is a small very weak hairdryer that I would not recommend using if you don't mind packing a dryer and voltage/outlet converter. I wish I thought of this. The TV stations are mostly French. There were two English stations in black & white (not sure why since all the other stations were in color) but, hopefully you are not in Paris to watch TV!! The location is perfect. We walked almost everywhere and anywhere we couldn't walk to, we could get a taxi on the corner or take the Metro within a block or two. Tons of restaurants nearby. We ate at a Japanese place right across the street and had breakfast on the corner. I would recommend NOT getting the breakfast there and just going down the street and grabbing a pastry and some juice. We did this every morning and it was less than the 13 Euro each that the hotel charges. The staff is excellent and friendly. They have a very open honesty policy when it came to whether or not you ate at the hotel in the morning. Aside from the funny lame hairdryer, the only other negative was the pigeons. They are really noisy in the early morning and we slept with the windows open most of the nights. I would either use the A/C or ear plugs. First time in Paris and would definitely stay there again!! We loved the Right bank as well, but, felt more at 'home' in the left bank close to St. Germain and the gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Sedge5878
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Clos Medicis for 4 nights between 19th and 23rd May 2008. The staff and facilities were excellent. The journey to the hotel couldnt be easier from Gare du Nord, just 3 stops on the RER B, just make sure you dont go at rush hour like us! It was very cosy! The room was actually larger than I had imagined and the bathroom was spotless, the shower was wonderful. The matress and bedding was very comfortable. The only downside to this hotel is that it is a good 10 minute walk to any metro station, however, it is also only 10 minutes to St Chappelle and Notre Dame, I guess we were spoilt on our last trip as we had two Metro stations within 2 minutes of our hotel. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean rooms and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sarah089
Reviews.Content: great location near lots of shops, bars and restaurants as well as the fabulous jardin de luxembourg. hotel is small and intimate with attentive staff and relaxed atmosphere. our room was average size (big by paris standards!) and the bed very comfy. small but functional bathroom. would recommend this place for the great location and clean environment.

Reviews.Title: “A favorite Paris location”
Reviews.Author: Jareth1212
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this hotel. The location is excellent with very close proximity to a metro station. The room is well equipped and very comfortable. Room was on the street side of the hotel and did not hear any noise at night. The staff has been very helpful during both visits. We really appreciated Luigi's assistance during our stay. His recommendations were fantastic and he was very attentive to our needs. I plan on staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely comfortable hotel with very pleasent staff”
Reviews.Author: arriva
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this lovely peaceful hotel. Very near everything especially the Luxembourg gardens. Walked to Marais, louvre etc but metro and buses very easy to use from this hotel.. We had a large double at a reduced rate (winter 4 day special) which was great value. Our large room was spotless, quiet and had a flat screen tv and a very comfortable bed. Plenty of storage and a well lit small bathroom. We were on 4th floor. The lounge is very nice with a real fire and the whole place is run very well. The staff are friendly and helpful which is not always the case in many hotels in Paris. A perfect stay!. (we had breakfast out. ) Despite being in the middle of everthing the room was quiet with double glazing and the whole place has a traquil atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A2Travel
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Hotel Le Clos Medicis for 3 days in July 2007 -- it was perfect. Easy to get to from the train station and near many little cafes and restaurants. The rooms are small but we didn't spend much time sleeping! The rooms were very clean and modern. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The free internet was a bonus! We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as there were many little cafes for a quick snack in the am while walking to the metro. The park (Luxemburg) is very close and beautiful. I posted a photo!

Reviews.Title: “Everything I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: CherithF013
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a side street off of St. Michaels. Which, like other reviews say, if cafe/bistro central!!! The hotel is small, but thats what I liked most about it. With 38 rooms that is set up like a house, you aren't bothered by massive amounts of traffic. The staff, like every said, is wonderful!! They know english well and treat you wonderfully. The breakfast is a bit pricey (we thought it was included) but you quickly learn there idea of breakfast and enjoy it every morning! The time of year that we went was suppose to be summer-ish weather, but it was chilly and rainy. Although, that never stopped us from enjoying ourselves. I would recommened this hotel to ANYONE. If you want, cute, quiant, and luxury all in one, this is a great hotel to choose. And as far as Paris goes, take your walking shoes because you will want to walk everywhere. I suggest taking the shopping walking route to the Eiffel Tower and then following the river back to the hotel. You see SOOOO many things and if you see a shop GO IN IT!!! We regreted not doing that and then trying to find it again the day we were leaving!!! Paris is Wonderful and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Beatar21
Reviews.Content: We were hesitant about what to expect from this hotel because of the mixed reviews we had read, but in the end were very pleased with our stay. The room was in fact small, but why complain? It was very cozy and most importantly, clean. The concierge was extremely helpful in recommending what to see and do, and the location is absolutely perfect - very close to everything! With a little travel book, that I highly recommend, "Inside Out Paris,' we circled, on foot, about the entire city. To give you an idea, I had a brand new pair of heeled boots, and after the 3 days en Pari, I had to get them re-heeled! The breakfast the hotel offers is nice & convenient, but if you don't want to pay the 12 or so euros, there are a number of fantastic bakeries and creperie stands nearby.There's also a great chocolate shop just down the street with delicious ice cream and last minute gifts (the chocolates) The lobby is very inviting and comfortable for lounging around with a glass of wine that you can purchase from the little bar. We would definitely return to this little gem & highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay for us...”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based upon the stellar reviews from Tripadvisor. All in all it was an OK stay. It was cleaned everyday and it is centrally located. To be fair, I think part of the problem for me was the hotel's size...it's very small...almost more like a B&B. Our room was comfortable but was the smallest I've stayed in before (even in Europe). We stayed in a Superior room so maybe booking a higher-priced room would have provided us with a little more space. Staff is very sweet and helpful. The hotel does have a small courtyard as well. If you can afford one of their top tier rooms - book it. Hotel does provide free Internet access in its lobby!

Reviews.Title: “fine”
Reviews.Author: HHV
Reviews.Content: We decided we wanted to visit the Kieferexposition in the Paris Grand Palais, did so at short notice, made reservations for just one night, left Amsterdam at 4.00 Friday night, arrived at Clos Medicis at 9.30 Saturday morning, and were received by personnel that, while very busy helping people to leave, almost apologized for not having our room ready. If that’s the way things stand in a hotel, there can’t be much to complain. And in this hotel there isn’t. People at the desk are courteous and in a very pleasant way too. After pointing out the parking (Rue Soufflot, the street leading up to the Pantheon, just opposite Luxembourg, at 200 meters) and advising us to take a cup of coffee, the room was ready one hour later. We found the room itself (nr. 14, first floor, street side), notwithstanding complaints on this site about the size of the rooms, excellent, modern, and comfortable. Beams in the ceiling, digital television, desk, large closet, modern bathroom. The hotel is part of the Hôtels de Charme. We booked on the hotel site and paid (for a luxury twin, last minute) 210 euros. The normal price would be 249 euros. Breakfast – on a Sunday morning – was in name a buffet, but in fact rather mediocre, while the space was very cramped. This sort of thing always surprises me: excellent hotel, lousy breakfast. Better to find a place outside, in the patio, if the weather allows, although you could do better elsewhere for € 13. Only real quibble you could have with this hotel would be the location. Rue Monsieur le Prince is a somewhat nondescript street running between Bd Saint Germain and the Luxembourg, in the 6th . The hotel is very close to the park, where the street ends on Bd. Saint Michel, 20 meters before the Place Rostand, which borders on the Luxembourg. Although many people on this site declared themselves to be happy with a RER very close by, that only works if you want to go to Charles the Gaulle, or Versailles. Most tourists would prefer a metro, and the closest station is Odéon, or Cluny La Sorbonne, both at least a ten minutes walk, which I personally find to far. But then I am definitely the lazy type. In the end I would probably prefer a hotel near Maubert, in the 5th, but that has nothing to do with the quality and service of Clos Medicis, which are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the 6th”
Reviews.Author: Binsted
Reviews.Content: We were planning to be in Paris for 3 days as part of a touring holiday. So we wanted a good 3 star hotel on the Left Bank, close to secure parking. Not an easy brief, especially over a busy weekend!! We chose this hotel based on the advice of other TravelAdvisor members, and it worked out well. The hotel is in good condition and clean. The room, for we paid 210 Euro a night, was neat but small -- not a surprise in Paris. It is in a quiet side street but there a parking garage on the other side of the intersection -- 2 minutes' walk at most. Altogether a good experience and one we would repeat and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ItalianinDublin
Reviews.Content: we stayed over just around the beginning of may, great little hotel., very handy if u r flying from Charles de Gaulle as the stop Luxemburg (the hotel its near the Jardin du Lux) its 3 min away so u can hop on the train back to the airport. The metro is on the other side (Odeon) The staff was really nice and the room was clean but typically parisian small and cozy, we had a room facing the internal court yard. Very pretty. didnt avail of the breakfast as the area all around is full of cafes. Also if u love japanese food this is a great spot as there are at least 10 restaurants on the same road!!! a bit pricey but all in all worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Little Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sunbury-Steve
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just enjoyed our first trip to Paris, staying at the Clos Medicis for 4 nights. I can only say that the hotel and its staff enhanced an truly enjoyable and memorable trip. The hotel was easy to get to from The Gard de Nord station, (arrived using Eurostar) having 2 Metro Stations ("Odeon" and "Cluny la Sorbonne") less than 10 minutes walk away, and an RER station ("Luxembourg") less than 5 minutes walk away! The hotel is situated conveniently about 15 minutes walk from the Seine and the Ile de la Citie upon which stands Notre Dame, a further 10-12 minute walk will take you to the Louvre. So the Clos Medicis location is a very good base to explore the city either on foot or using public transport. The hotel is in a side street Rue Monsieur le Prince of the main road Boulevard St Michel which runs north to the river. The street is not noisy or overly busy, but has numerous Japanese and Sushi resturants, all very similar. We were told that they are all owned by just 2 persons, and are worth trying out. On first viewing the hotel is smart and chic, but inviting, with a sunken lounge area to the right with a small bar, sofas, tables and in the evening a real fire. The reception area is manned 24 hours a day, and without exception the staff were polite, friendly and very very helpful. They put themselves out to give advice, directions and recommendations all of which was useful and accurate. Behind the reception is the dining area. This is a little small, especially if all the guests wished to part-take of the continental breakfast at once, but perhaps more by luck than judgement the guests "staggered" themselves, and we were never without a table to ourselves. There is a small, very small lift to the upper floors, we used the staircase. There are only about 24 rooms, so the hotel has a close knit "homey" atmosphere often missing from the larger homogenised establishments. We were taken to our double room, which was of a size commensurate with a 3 star hotel. It was very clean and tastefully appointed. The en-suite was also a reasonable size and clean, well decorated and appointed. The outstanding feature was the extra high ceiling (as throughout the hotel) which had the original exposed beams, which were wonderfully warped and of different dimensions and different joints. The shell of the hotel is several hundred years old, and the retention of these period features oozed character amid the modern facilities. As a sleeper who is disturbed more by light than noise I was gladdened by the inclusion of a heavy curtain liner, when drawn the room was PITCH BLACK! Excellent. The bed was comfortable, and we both slept soundly during our time at the hotel. Each day a maid service made the bed and replaced the already ample supply of towels, and the en-suite was contantly topped up with toilet rolls and kleenex tissues. The room was equipped with a TV, but the only channel in English was CNN, the BBC news channel wasn't transmitting for some reason. But you don't go to Paris to watch the TV ! The continental breakfast was also very good, with a selection of cereals, croissant's, jams and preserves, pastries, bread rolls, cheese and hams, eggs, fresh fruit and freshly squeezed fruit juices, aswell as a pot of excellent coffee. The girl who served was the only staff member who spoke no English, but she was charming and so helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel, I have personally put it in my back pocket for my next visit to Paris. The staff particularly made the place, which had a charm and character of its own. Try it out!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: dav504
Reviews.Content: For those of you who couldn't care less about atmosphere and just want a clean place to shower and sleep, then this review is not for you. I booked a last minute trip to Paris and was having a tough time in choosing a 3 star hotel. The only available properties seemed to be in charmless generic looking properties that charged about $175-$200 a night and none of them were getting the types of customer reviews that made me want to book there. Anything somewhat attractive or stylish were in the 4 star properties at a much higher $350-$500 a night. I am a sucker for boutique hotels as I appreciate more of a clean modern style, but that look was completely missing in the three star category. The Hotel Le Clos Medicis was one of the few that had more of a 4 star look to it; more upscale and stylish. The room prices seemed in line with other three star hotels but unfortunately single and double room rates were sold out so I splurged for a Queen size room which at $275 was still much less than a much smaller room would have been at a 4 star hotel. The hotel lobby is very charming, with comfortable couches and chairs and a mixture of modern and eclectic looks including a fireplace. It's the type of room you'd be happy to hang out in and have a coffee or a drink, and many of the guests were doing just that. As for my room, the size was better than average but most likely because it was a queen room. The style was very clean and modern with a flat screen tv (that looked and sounded worse than a normal tv). Also, they don't use those disgusting generic bed spreads that shouldn't be touched with tweezers let alone by a body. Instead they use changeable duvet covers; much more in line with better hotels. The bathroom was of average size (small) but very modern and attractive, with a nice towel warmer. I will never get used to those half glass shower doors that allow water to spray all over the bathroom. Lastly, for those of you who like me, are slightly germ conscious (this applies to those that open bathroom doors with paper towels), they use plastic bags in the garbage pails.
