For those of you who don't know what I'm talking about, then please disregard. The staff is friendly and helpful but one can tell the difference between a 3 and 4 star hotel when 1. you ask for a wake up call and they forget, and 2. you ask for a box of tissues at 11:00 pm and they tell you that you will need to come down to the lobby to pick them up. If that is the worst thing to happen, then you are in pretty good shape. If you can get a rate that is in line with other three star properties or even slightly more, than absolutely stay at this hotel. Also, the area is great; a few blocks away from St. Germaine and the Odeon metro. Keep in mind that I did not see a single or double room so do not know the sizes.

Reviews.Title: “Will recommend!”
Reviews.Author: CaribeMiami
Reviews.Content: As first timers in Europe, we started our 2wk vacation in this little/ intimate hotel. We stayed for 4nights in the Classic room. Although the room was somewhat small, it was perfect for my girlfriend and I. Remember you're not moving to the hotel/room. All you need a comfortable place to go rest from all the walking. The bed was extremely comfortable! The place itself makes one feel at home. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. As for breakfast, we never had it. 12euros seemed a bit much. However, we'd gladly recommend a little joint (Le Fournil) that is a few store fronts to the right of the hotel. The crepes and sandwiches are GREAT! A must to try and the food is relatively cheap....Euro cheap, not $ cheap. Would definitely return.....

Reviews.Title: “Room to Breathe”
Reviews.Author: Jon from Dallas
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hotel le Clos Medicis several nights on two occasions over the years...each was a special time in this lovely little hotel. The reviews are in, and Hotel le Clos Medicis is a hit with most visitors. But time and again I read of the chief disappointment of her guests...that of the tiny typically Parisian rooms at this hotel. As savvy travelers we can deal with it, or you can take this major hint on how to cure your claustrophobia...CHAMBRE DOUZE! That's ROOM 12 for my fellow Texans. It's a secret for only those TripAdvisor fans who are clever enough to read before they go. ROOM 12 is a deluxe room - two twin beds/king with a blue and white tiled shower. It's at the top of your semi-private stone-hewned spiral staircase accessed just ten feet from the front desk. Yes, the room is tiny - you can view photos on the hotel website...Room 12 is seen in the very last two photos of the slide show - but there are two sets of French doors which both open onto your very own private terrace. Voila'! Darn if the terrace is as big as the room itself! And there's a table for two and a view of the rooftops around Luxembourg. Street noise? Not in Room 12! But in the morning you can eavesdrop on the breakfasters in the courtyard below and enjoy the songbirds and the sounds of Paris coming alive. Trust me. You will be the envy of the other guests wondering how you lucked-out with Room 12. I'll return to Hotel le Clos Medicis, but only if I can stay in Chambre Douze.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Aha2ala
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this gem of a hotel last weekend and were delighted with the hotel, staff and area. We made our booking directly with the hotel, as this gave us the best price, rather than using some of the hotel sites, which were more expensive. We originally made a 3 night booking, but ended up in London for the 2nd night of the 3. I amended our booking by email, and the hotel kindly agreed to keep our luggage for the night we were away. We therefore had different rooms for our first night and last night, and were impressed by the style of both the rooms. We paid €102.50 a night, which was a special offer with the hotel. Our first room was number 65, on the top floor, accessed by the lift to the fifth floor and then a short flight of steps to the two rooms on the 6th floor. We were delighted when we opened the door, to find a beautifully decorated room, just like the photos we had seen, with a flat screen tv, nice linens, velvet edged bedspreads, matching velvet edged curtains, and we had a stunning bathroom upstairs, accessed by a spiral staircase in the corner of the room. The bathroom was white tiled, (very clean), twin sinks, power shower with shower screen, thick bathrobes, huge bright mirror etc. Our second room was on the third floor - number 36 - and is the burgundy and white walled room with the navy blue bed, which is shown in some of the photos on other sites. Again the bathroom was clean and well decorated, although smaller and decorated with terracotta floor tiles. Rather confusing tho is the fact that there are two lifts - one takes you to the even rooms, and one to the odd rooms. The floors must be split somehow, as there only ever seemed to be three rooms per floor, so there must be some split level thing going on. We chose not to have breakfast in the hotel - we felt the €12 per person charge was slightly steep - but a five minute walk from the hotel (turn left down Rue Monsieur le Prince) at the corner of Boulevard Saint-Germain there is a super eatery with red awnings where we had a set breakfast of croissants, jam and coffee for €6 each. I'm sorry I forget its name, but its a large establishment with lots of tables outside, and plenty of tables inside by the windows, so you can't miss it. There were painters and decoraters in the the hotel during our stay, but they were very polite and very unobtrusive, and we certainly didn't feel that we were in the middle of a redecoration. The hotel is a five minute walk from the Luxembourg metro station. This is on the RER blue line, which takes you directly to Charles De Gaulle airport. All in all, a lovely hotel, and we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great little Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early June for three nights and throughly enjoyed our time. This was our third visit to Paris and the first time at Le Clos Medicis. The rooms are typically Parisian smallish but clean and well organised. The staff were most helpful assisting with bookings and travel advice. The hotel is well maintained and in good order. Breakfast in the courtyard was delightful. We will stay at Le Clos Medicis next time we come to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from a delightful stay at Le Clos Medici. The rooms are on the small size (normal for Paris I'm told) but with a good sized bathroom and shower. We were on the 5th floor which was very quiet. We did not take breakfast in the hotel because the designated area was a bit uninspiring and it was a bit too cold to use the courtyard area, which was pleasant. The real bonus here is the location - in a relaxed and pleasant environment and just a minute from Luxemberg metro and is fairly central to most of the 'must see and do activity'. This station also links directly with the Orly shuttle train at Anthony. The other alternative we had looked at was near the Champs Elysee, and having ventured there realised we had made the right decision. I would certainly book here again and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this charming hotel for 5 days and found the staff and location fantastic and will be returning later on in the year!!
